I'm happy to help you with that!

First, congratulations on the new Peak Design bag! It's great that you're excited to use it, and I'm sure you'll get used to the layout soon.

Now, let's get to the essentials you should pack in your camera bag for your hike:

**Camera and Lenses:**

* Your camera body(ies)
* Lenses (prime, zoom, wide-angle, telephoto, etc.)
* Lens hoods and caps
* Lens cleaning cloth and cleaning solution

**Tripod and Stabilization:**

* Tripod (make sure it's sturdy and suitable for your camera weight)
* Tripod head (ballhead or panhead)
* Remote shutter release (glad you ordered a new one!)
* Camera strap (if you prefer to carry your camera separately)

**Memory and Power:**

* Memory cards (with sufficient storage and speed)
* Extra batteries (at least one or two spares)
* Battery charger (if you have space)
* Portable power bank (optional, but recommended for extended shoots)

**Filters and Accessories:**

* UV filter (for lens protection)
* Polarizing filter (for reducing glare and enhancing colors)
* Neutral density (ND) filters (for creative effects or long exposures)
* Camera rain cover or poncho (if you're expecting rain)
* Lens filters and adapters (if you have specialized lenses)

**Personal and Miscellaneous:**

* Water bottle and snacks (to keep you energized during the hike)
* First-aid kit (with essentials like bandages, antiseptic wipes, and pain relievers)
* Map and compass (and/or a GPS device or smartphone with GPS)
* Sunscreen, insect repellent, and any personal medications
* Extra cash and a credit card (in case you need to stop for supplies or emergencies)

**Peak Design Bag Organization Tips:**

* Assign a specific compartment or pocket for each item to maintain organization and quick access.
* Use dividers or separators to keep similar items together (e.g., lenses, filters, batteries).
* Store frequently used items in easy-to-reach pockets or compartments.
* Consider labeling your compartments or pockets to help you find items quickly.

Remember to check the weather forecast and adjust your packing list accordingly. It's also a good idea to double-check your bag before heading out to ensure you have everything you need.

Have a great hike and enjoy capturing amazing shots with your new Peak Design bag!
